contentrichtext.text: {{About|Noop, the programming language|the mathematical model of object-oriented programming|NOOP (Mathematical Model of OOP)|the processor instruction (usually written "NOP")|NOP}} {{Infobox programming language | name = Noop | typing = [[static typing|static]] | year = 2009 | license = [[Apache License]] 2.0 | website = http://code.google.com/p/noop }} '''Noop''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|n|oʊ|.|ɒ|p}}, like [[NOP]]) was a project from [[Google]] aiming to develop a new programming language. Noop attempts to blend the best features of "old" and "new" languages, while syntactically encouraging good programming practice. Noop is initially targeted to run on the [[Java Virtual Machine]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://code.google.com/p/noop/|title=Noop - project hosting on Google Code}}</ref> According to one of the project owners, "It's dead".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://groups.google.com/group/noop/browse_thread/thread/574fb7ae72322e00|title=Noop - Is this project dead?}}</ref> == Examples == [[Hello world]] in Noop <source lang="java"> import noop.Application; import noop.Console; class HelloWorld(Console console) implements Application { Int main(List args) { String s = "Hello World!"; console.println(s); return 0; } } </source> == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.h-online.com/open/Noop-a-new-language-for-the-JVM--/news/114262 H-Online article about Noop] * [http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/09/17/google_noop/ Article about Noop by The Register] * [http://adtmag.com/articles/2009/09/29/new-language-for-java-by-google-developers-gains-interest.aspx Article about Noop by ADT Magazine] [[Category:Object-oriented programming languages]] [[Category:Discontinued Google software]]
